Classical.Structure: The primary cortical region of the brain that receives, integrates, and processes visual information relayed from the retinas. (Brodmann areas 17, 18, 19).
Classical.Function: Processes basic visual features (edges, orientation, color) in V1, and more complex features (shape, motion) in higher visual areas (V2-V5).
Classical.Pathology: Cortical blindness, visual agnosia, motion blindness (akinetopsia).

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: Quantum-level effects in photoreceptors (L3.Eye.Retina) are decohered into classical spike trains, which are then processed here.
SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: Hierarchical processing of spike trains. Center-surround receptive fields, orientation columns, and hypercolumns. Gamma oscillations bind visual features.
SCPN.L3_GenomicEpigeneticMorphogenetic: Visual experience during critical developmental periods shapes the morphogenetic structure of V1 (e.g., ocular dominance columns).
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Formalizes tissue-level dynamics via phase-coupled oscillators, quasicritical operation (Griffiths regimes), and multi-path coupling (gap junctions, ephaptic fields, glial/vascular slow control). Models entrainment to cosmological rhythms (Schumann, lunar) via biophotons and cryptochromes.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: Generates the raw 'visual qualia' or 'field of vision' for the L5 self-model. It is the 'screen' upon which vision is projected.
SCPN.L9_MemoryHolograph: Receives top-down projections from L9 memory stores, allowing 'mental imagery' to be 'seen' on the visual cortex.

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The internal 'movie screen' where photonic data from the external world is rendered for the internal observer (L5).

Falsification_Hypotheses: V1 neurons will fire in response to auditory, not visual, stimuli.
Destruction of V1 will have no impact on the conscious perception of vision.
Experimental_Protocols: Single-unit recording in V1 (e.g., Hubel & Wiesel experiments) to map receptive fields.
fMRI retinotopy to map the visual field onto the cortex.
Simulation_Suite: Simulate a Gabor filter bank to model V1 simple cell responses.
